intro: Payena obtusifolia, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and broad, elliptic leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by dark blue, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
